content:
Doing low-impact exercises once a week is better than doing no exercise at all, and some benefits can still be seen. However, to achieve significant health and fitness benefits, it is recommended to engage in moderate-intensity exercise for at least 150 minutes per week, which equates to 30 minutes per day, five days per week.

Regular exercise provides numerous benefits, such as improving cardiovascular health, reducing the risk of chronic diseases, increasing muscle strength and endurance, and promoting better overall mental health. However, these benefits are typically seen with consistent exercise over time. Doing low-impact exercise once a week may help maintain general fitness levels, but it may not be enough to see significant improvements in health markers or physical fitness.

To get the most benefits from low-impact exercise, aim to incorporate it into your weekly routine on a regular basis. Starting slowly and gradually increasing the duration and intensity over time can help you build up your fitness level and reduce the risk of injury. Additionally, consulting with a healthcare provider or certified fitness professional can help you develop an exercise routine that meets your individual needs and goals.
